Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the optimization comes from the coins being notarized to BTC... so KMD needs optimize to notarize to BTC.... and AC need optimize to notarize to KMD

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: but doesn't the block header get notarised to BTC

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: then the BTC TXID back to KMD?

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: just an assumption, I don't actually know how it works

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I was confused at first of this too, as the KMD hash is broadcast to BTC first, if that goes through then the txid of that tx gets notarized into KMD

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but the optimizations seem to work in reverse of this

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you need to repond faster in building the hash thats sent to BTC but the BTC transaction itself is not important in speed

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: but don't 13 notarys need to sign the BTC TX?

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: or is that just the KMD TX

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: I thought that's what we were racing for

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes, but to get into beskmaks the fastest and be included in a round, all you need to do is ca;lculate the hash thats sent to BTC chain, the actual BTC transaction comes later in the process

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: why we need a KMD wallet for this, seems just to amke sure we actually have the UTXO to make the TX

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: that seems the bottelnexk in the code

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Decker hardware accelerated the cacluation of the hash and it pales in comparison to just using less utxo.
